# The `SCEVExpander` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class uses information about analyze scalars to rewrite expressions in canonical form. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::SCEVExpander</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class uses information about analyze scalars to rewrite expressions in canonical form.

Clients should create an instance of this class when rewriting is needed, and destroy it when finished to allow the release of the associated memory.

Definition at line 63 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h">ScalarEvolutionExpander.h</a>.

### expandCodeFor() {#ac711b5659270bd9e66b8f38ec481260c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; SCEVExpander::expandCodeFor (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; SH, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> I)</>}>

Return the induction variable increment&#39;s IV operand.

getIVIncOperand returns an induction variable increment&#39;s induction variable operand.

If allowScale is set, any type of GEP is allowed as long as the nonIV operands dominate InsertPos.

If allowScale is not set, ensure that a GEP increment conforms to one of the simple patterns generated by getAddRecExprPHILiterally and expandAddtoGEP. If the pattern isn&#39;t recognized, return NULL.

This is used to check whether S can be expanded cheaply.

L is a hint which tells in which loop to look for the suitable value.

Note that this function does not perform an exhaustive search. I.e if it didn&#39;t find any value it does not mean that there is no such value.

### hoistIVInc() {#aa3255071e8195c43058f7e265c54677f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SCEVExpander::hoistIVInc (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; IncV, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; InsertPos, bool RecomputePoisonFlags=false)</>}>
Utility for hoisting <code>IncV</code> (with all subexpressions requried for its computation) before <code>InsertPos</code>.

hoistStep - Attempt to hoist a simple IV increment above InsertPos to make it available to other uses in this loop.

If <code>RecomputePoisonFlags</code> is set, drops all poison-generating flags from instructions being hoisted and tries to re-infer them in the new location. It should be used when we are going to introduce a new use in the new position that didn&#39;t exist before, and may trigger new UB in case of poison.

Recursively hoist any operands, until we reach a value that dominates InsertPos.

### expandAddToGEP() {#a567935fdae75b6acc865c1b66aa4311a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; SCEVExpander::expandAddToGEP (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; Offset, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f">SCEV::NoWrapFlags</a> Flags)</>}>
Expand a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevaddexpr">SCEVAddExpr</a> with a pointer type into a GEP instead of using ptrtoint+arithmetic+inttoptr.

expandAddToGEP - Expand an addition expression with a pointer type into a GEP instead of using ptrtoint+arithmetic+inttoptr.

This helps BasicAliasAnalysis and other passes analyze the result. See the rules for getelementptr vs. inttoptr in <a href="http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#pointeraliasing">http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#pointeraliasing</a> for details.

Design note: The correctness of using getelementptr here depends on <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> not recognizing inttoptr and ptrtoint operators, as they may introduce pointer arithmetic which may not be safely converted into getelementptr.

Design note: It might seem desirable for this function to be more loop-aware. If some of the indices are loop-invariant while others aren&#39;t, it might seem desirable to emit multiple GEPs, keeping the loop-invariant portions of the overall computation outside the loop. However, there are a few reasons this is not done here. Hoisting simple arithmetic is a low-level optimization that often isn&#39;t very important until late in the optimization process. In fact, passes like InstructionCombining will combine GEPs, even if it means pushing loop-invariant computation down into loops, so even if the GEPs were split here, the work would quickly be undone. The LoopStrengthReduction pass, which is usually run quite late (and after the last InstructionCombining pass), takes care of hoisting loop-invariant portions of expressions, after considering what can be folded using target addressing modes.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h/#l00460">460</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h">ScalarEvolutionExpander.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-cpp/#l00360">360</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-cpp">ScalarEvolutionExpander.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### fixupInsertPoints() {#a64986ad1d7ce9af41f0d780e8c0d6e67}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SCEVExpander::fixupInsertPoints (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I)</>}>
If the insert point of the current builder or any of the builders on the stack of saved builders has &#39;I&#39; as its insert point, update it to point to the instruction after &#39;I&#39;.

This is intended to be used when the instruction &#39;I&#39; is being moved. If this fixup is not done and &#39;I&#39; is moved to a different block, the inconsistent insert point (with a mismatched <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> and Block) can lead to an instruction being inserted in a block other than its parent.

  prototype={<>bool SCEVExpander::isExpandedAddRecExprPHI (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42; PN, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; IncV, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L)</>}>
Determine if this cyclic phi is in a form that would have been generated by LSR.

We don&#39;t care if the phi was actually expanded in this pass, as long as it is in a low-cost form, for example, no implied multiplication. This should match any patterns generated by getAddRecExprPHILiterally and expandAddtoGEP.

### CanonicalMode {#af49abbf03c5d46468304e5166990598d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::SCEVExpander::CanonicalMode">
When true, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander">SCEVExpander</a> tries to expand expressions in &quot;canonical&quot; form.

When false, expressions are expanded in a more literal form.

In &quot;canonical&quot; form addrecs are expanded as arithmetic based on a canonical induction variable. Note that CanonicalMode doesn&#39;t guarantee that all expressions are expanded in &quot;canonical&quot; form. For some expressions literal mode can be preferred.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h/#l00122">122</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h">ScalarEvolutionExpander.h</a>.

### LSRMode {#a6c3ec10b8aa0d9f2e18bd287d27da800}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::SCEVExpander::LSRMode">
When invoked from LSR, the expander is in &quot;strength reduction&quot; mode.

The only difference is that phi&#39;s are only reused if they are already in &quot;expanded&quot; form.

### PostIncLoops {#a2cf670fa81b4a4fcec22a7a9ea79798b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="PostIncLoopSet llvm::SCEVExpander::PostIncLoops">
Addrecs referring to any of the given loops are expanded in post-inc mode.

For example, expanding &#123;1,+,1&#125;&lt;L&gt; in post-inc mode returns the add instruction that adds one to the phi for &#123;0,+,1&#125;&lt;L&gt;, as opposed to a new phi starting at 1. This is only supported in non-canonical mode.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h/#l00102">102</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h">ScalarEvolutionExpander.h</a>.

## Public Static Functions

### canReuseFlagsFromOriginalIVInc() {#aad8311debca961aeee16791414f9efa1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SCEVExpander::canReuseFlagsFromOriginalIVInc (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42; OrigPhi, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42; WidePhi, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; OrigInc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; WideInc)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if both increments directly increment the corresponding IV PHI nodes and have the same opcode.

It is not safe to re-use the flags from the original increment, if it is more complex and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expansion may have yielded a more simplified wider increment.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h/#l00290">290</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-h">ScalarEvolutionExpander.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-cpp/#l00855">855</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/scalarevolutionexpander-cpp">ScalarEvolutionExpander.cpp</a>.
